dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So there was this idea floating around that President Biden might not sign that Hong Kong bill, you know, given the trade talks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So there was this idea floating around that President Biden might not sign that Hong Kong bill, you know, given the trade talks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was previously unclear if Trump would sign the bill into law. The president has been relatively silent on Hong Kong as he negotiates a trade deal with Chinas President Xi Jinping.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but he did sign it on Wednesday, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, which Congress passed almost unanimously last week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but he did sign it on Wednesday, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, which Congress passed almost unanimously last week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, after days of uncertainty surrounding his willingness to confront Beijing as he attempts to hammer out a trade deal with China. The bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, was passed almost unanimously by both houses of Congress last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's a pretty strong move—it mandates sanctions for human rights violators in Hong Kong and requires annual reports on China's actions there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's a pretty strong move-it mandates sanctions for human rights violators in Hong Kong and requires annual reports on China's actions there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would mandate that the president impose sanctions against people found to be violating human rights in Hong Kong and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Biden said he signed it, um, out of respect for President Xi and the people of Hong Kong, hoping it leads to an amicable resolution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Biden said he signed it, um, out of respect for President Xi and the people of Hong Kong, hoping it leads to an amicable resolution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement announcing the signing, Trump said he signed the bill out of respect for President Xi, China and the people of Hong Kong. They are being enacted in the hope that Leaders and Representatives of China and Hong Kong will be able to amicably settle their differences leading to long-term peace and prosperity for all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Senator Bernie Sanders called it a meaningful tool to deter Beijing's interference, especially after Taiwan's elections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Senator Bernie Sanders called it a meaningful tool to deter Beijing's interference, especially after Taiwan's elections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. now has new and meaningful tools to deter further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kongs internal affairs, said Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill. Following last weekends historic elections in Hong Kong that included record turnout, this new law could not be more timely in showing strong U.S. support for Hong Kongers long-cherished freedoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because, uh, until now, Biden had been pretty quiet on Hong Kong while negotiating trade with Xi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because, uh, until now, Biden had been pretty quiet on Hong Kong while negotiating trade with Xi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president has been relatively silent on Hong Kong as he negotiates a trade deal with Chinas President Xi Jinping. In an interview on Fox and Friends last week, Trump said, We have to stand with Hong Kong, but Im also standing with President Xi, when asked if he would sign the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and remember those protests started over an extradition bill months ago? Even though it's withdrawn, the movement's grown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and remember those protests started over an extradition bill months ago? Even though it's withdrawn, the movement's grown.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pro-democracy protests erupted in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong months ago over a bill that would extradite those accused of committing a crime in Hong Kong to mainland China. While the bill has been withdrawn from consideration, the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city, sometimes devolving into violent clashes between protesters and police officers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's turned into this broader push against Beijing's control, sometimes getting really violent with the police.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's turned into this broader push against Beijing's control, sometimes getting really violent with the police.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the bill has been withdrawn from consideration, the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city, sometimes devolving into violent clashes between protesters and police officers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this law's timing is huge—it shows U.S. support right when tensions are high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this law's timing is huge-it shows U.S. support right when tensions are high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like a significant moment in U.S.-China relations, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like a significant moment in U.S.-China relations, for sure.

artist_script:
HostA: So there was this idea floating around that President Biden might not sign that Hong Kong bill, you know, given the trade talks.
HostB: Yeah, but he did sign it on Wednesday, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, which Congress passed almost unanimously last week.
HostA: Right, and it’s a pretty strong move—it mandates sanctions for human rights violators in Hong Kong and requires annual reports on China’s actions there.
HostB: And Biden said he signed it, um, out of respect for President Xi and the people of Hong Kong, hoping it leads to an amicable resolution.
HostA: Senator Bernie Sanders called it a meaningful tool to deter Beijing’s interference, especially after Taiwan’s elections.
HostB: Which is interesting because, uh, until now, Biden had been pretty quiet on Hong Kong while negotiating trade with Xi.
HostA: Exactly, and remember those protests started over an extradition bill months ago? Even though it’s withdrawn, the movement’s grown.
HostB: Yeah, it’s turned into this broader push against Beijing’s control, sometimes getting really violent with the police.
HostA: So this law’s timing is huge—it shows U.S. support right when tensions are high.
HostB: Definitely feels like a significant moment in U.S.-China relations, for sure.
